time_markers.text: Shortly after taking office in May 2000
quotes: Shortly after taking office in May 2000, he established the Financial Sector Review Group under the leadership of John Lipsky
In March 2001, on the group's recommendations, he created the International Capital Markets Department, a unit to anticipate and head off financial crises in countries to which the fund makes loans.

In 2001, Köhler recommended naming Timothy Geithner to replace Stanley Fischer as deputy managing director; instead, the US government under President George W. Bush successfully pushed for Anne O. Krueger to take the position.

time_markers.text: a year before his term was scheduled to end in May 2005
quotes: In order to accept his nomination as presidential candidate, Köhler left the IMF a year before his term was scheduled to end in May 2005.
He lived in Washington, D.C., from 2000 to 2004.
9th president of Germany, 2004–2010
On 4 March 2004, Köhler resigned his post with the IMF after being nominated by Germany's conservative and liberal opposition parties (CDU/CSU and FDP) as their presidential candidate.

time_markers.text: on 1 July 2004, for a five-year term
quotes: Köhler succeeded Johannes Rau as president on 1 July 2004, for a five-year term.
From 2004 until early 2006, Charlottenburg Palace was the seat of the President of Germany, whilst Schloss Bellevue was being renovated.

organizations.name: World Bank
quotes: to reduce overlapping activity with the World Bank.

organizations.name: Bundesversammlung
quotes: As these parties controlled a majority of votes in the Bundesversammlung ('Federal Assembly': an electoral college consisting of the membership of the Bundestag and an equal number of delegates appointed by the legislatures of each state), the result of the vote amounted to essentially a foregone conclusion, but was closer than expected.

organizations.name: Bundestag
quotes: As these parties controlled a majority of votes in the Bundesversammlung ('Federal Assembly': an electoral college consisting of the membership of the Bundestag and an equal number of delegates appointed by the legislatures of each state), the result of the vote amounted to essentially a foregone conclusion, but was closer than expected.

roles.title: deputy managing director
quotes: In 2001, Köhler recommended naming Timothy Geithner to replace Stanley Fischer as deputy managing director; instead, the US government under President George W. Bush successfully pushed for Anne O. Krueger to take the position.

roles.title: 9th president of Germany
quotes: 9th president of Germany, 2004–2010
He lived in Washington, D.C., from 2000 to 2004.
Among his accomplishments were overseeing debt crises in Brazil and Turkey and expanding debt relief for the world's poorest countries.
Among his accomplishments were overseeing debt crises in Brazil and Turkey and expanding debt relief for the world's poorest countries.
He had less success resolving the continuing debt problems in Argentina.
From 2004 until early 2006, Charlottenburg Palace was the seat of the President of Germany, whilst Schloss Bellevue was being renovated.
From 2004 until early 2006, Charlottenburg Palace was the seat of the President of Germany, whilst Schloss Bellevue was being renovated.
